meanings.definition: A representation or image, especially of a person.
meanings.sent1: The artist created an effigy of the president for the museum.
meanings.sent2: The effigy of the famous actress was displayed in the town square.
meanings.sent3: At the party, they made an effigy of the birthday girl out of balloons.
meanings.sent4: The effigy of the king stood tall in the grand hall, watching over his subjects.
meanings.sent5: In the art class, the students sculpted an effigy of their teacher using clay.

meanings.definition: A crude representation of someone disliked, used for purposes of ridicule.
meanings.sent1: During the protest, they burned an effigy of the corrupt politician.
meanings.sent2: The effigy of the bully was hung from a tree as a warning to others.
meanings.sent3: In the comedy skit, they used an effigy of the teacher to poke fun at her strict rules.
meanings.sent4: The effigy of the villain in the play was so lifelike, it sent shivers down the audience's spines.
meanings.sent5: The effigy of the monster in the haunted house was so realistic, visitors screamed in terror.
